name: CompTIA Network+ Certification
description: A globally recognized, vendor-neutral credential that validates an IT professional's foundational skills in configuring, managing, and troubleshooting wired and wireless networks

name: CompTIA Project+ Certification
description: A vendor-neutral, entry-level credential that validates the foundational skills needed to manage small- to medium-sized projects.  It covers on essential project management concepts that are applicable across a wide range of methodologies and industries.

name: AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner
description: A foundational, entry-level certification that validates a broad, high-level understanding of the Amazon Web Services (AWS) Cloud. It is designed for individuals new to the cloud, including those in technical and non-technical roles, such as sales, marketing, and project management.

name: ITIL Foundation Certificate in IT Service Management
description: an entry-level certification that introduces the core principles, concepts, and terminology of the ITIL (Information Technology Infrastructure Library) framework. It is the first step in the ITIL certification path, providing a foundational understanding of modern IT service management (ITSM) for IT and non-IT professionals.

name: WGU Back-End Developer Certificate
description: Recognizes specific skills in Object-Oriented Programming (OOP), Java Programming, structures query language (SQL), database management, software design patterns, Spring Framework, mySQL, and mobile application development.

name: WGU Front-End Developer Certificate
description: Recognizes proficiency in creating responsive, visually captivating, and fully functional websites.  Recognizes mastery of Front End Design, JavaScript, Cascading Style Sheets (CSS), HyperText Markup Language (HTML), and Software Development.
